children.subject: looking for a role, havent had any quant internship

So the best classes for interviewing for quant roles are: Stat 134/140 and EE 126 for basic probability stuff and Markov chain content. You'll get asked a lot of questions within these topics. They'll ask you a lot of linear algebra stuff too so Math 110 and EE 127 are helpful for that. The rest depends on the nature of the firm and what they're looking for: Stat 151A is a good course since regression really is the bread and butter of a lot of signal research, CS 189 and Stat 154 are good for more sophisticated techniques.

Would not recommend Stat 205A, the content isn't that helpful for interviews; to this date nobody has asked me about the convergence properties of martingales or the behavior of simple random walks in an interview. 

The most important aspect of interviewing though, even more than the classes listed above, is finding people to refer you to their companies. A referral will help you far more than any single class.

Do you want a quant role, or do you already have a quant role ready and looking to best prepare for you once you begin your job?

AFAIK there isn't any math class that is directly useful for quant roles; the ones that are directly useful are stats (and certain EECS courses that have a lot of overlap).
Warning:  Math 218ab are some of the hardest classes in the department.  Don’t take them unless you have a solid background in measure theory(202ab or equivalent).

Would disagree on both accounts; Math 218A is a very tough class, but it has a high degree of variance amongst the difficulty depending on the professor. I would say that claiming its one of the hardest classes in the department is a stretch though. When Professor Ganguly taught last semester knowing measure theory prior to the class was not essential, but when Professor Pitman teaches measure theory is essential. 

However if "looking good" is the point, then 210A/B is probably a better choice, since its a tough class but at least somewhat relevant to what people in the industry do.

People I have talked to recommend Stat 134, 140 and EE 126. Note that the first part of EE126 generally covers quant interview material. Also it might not hurt to do Stat 205a (also called Math 218a/b which probability theory. Probably wont use the stuff from the grad class but it looks good given how competitive quant is.

history.content: I only have a yr left and was wondering which math classes (excluding stats classes) I should prioritize for quant roles. I haven't taken any math upper divs except stat 134. cheers
history.subject: math classes for quant roles
